title: Drawing, "Design for the Obelisk of St. Dominic, Piazza San Domenico Maggiore, Naples", ca. 1737
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, black chalk on cream laid paper
markings: Watermark: Circle with running horse above P
signed: Signed in pen and brown ink at lower right: D Ant. Vaccaro m p
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink at upper center:  Domenico Antonio Vaccaro
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description:
Lower section consists of a bilateral design for a hexagonal platform with posts with alternate suggestions on each side. The platform is shown from above. The obelisk is divided in many sections. The plans of the lower half are hexagonal. Various ornaments decorate the sections, including a mermaid, brackets with urns, and an escutcheon with cherub above.
Angels stand on brackets and there is a bust of a Pope on the frontispiece. At top of pedestal, seated and kneeling angels carrying a sphere upon which a saint stands. There is a dog with a torch beside him.

(Study for plague monument in Piazza before S. Domenico Maggiore, Naples.)
